Serialized Form

  • Package edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject.EmptyMember extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • seen

          boolean seen
          The boolean seen, determines if an object is to be revealed or not, to the player.

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject.Entity extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • seen

          boolean seen
          The boolean seen is mainly used for the ninjas, this attribute depends on whether or not the player is within range to actually see the ninja.

        • position

          int[] position
          The integer array size 2 position keeps track of an entities's position. This array will change dynamically as the ninjas and the player will be moving around constantly.

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject.ExtraBullet extends PowerUp implements Serializable

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject.GameEngine extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • thePlayer

          Taha thePlayer
          The Taha object to be used in the game. It is passed into the Grid when it is created in the constructor for this class.

        • grid

          Grid grid
          The Grid object to be used in the game and referred to by the GameEngine

        • playerDirection

          int playerDirection
          This is the direction the player is "facing" on the Grid

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject.Grid extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      123456789L

      • Serialized Fields

        • grid

          GridMember[][] grid
          The GridMember object is created to hold the 9 x 9 grid that is the map of the game. The Grid Member class is an interface for anything that is on the grid.

        • ninjaOctopi

          NinjaOctopi[] ninjaOctopi
          The object NinjaOctopi was originally ninjas, but was changed to add some flavor to the game. There are 6 ninja octopi objects in the game. Their attributes will be explained in the NinjaOctopi class.

        • player

          GridMember player
          In the GridMember player object, this object will take on the attributes of the Taha class which is shown in the constructor.

        • playerPosition

          int[] playerPosition
          The array playerPosition will hold the player's current position. This position will be called in order to move the player or check if a ninja can murder the player.'

        • radar

          PowerUp radar
          The PowerUp radar is a power up that will grant the player the ability to see where the briefcase is.

        • extraBullet

          PowerUp extraBullet
          The PowerUp extraBullet will add 1 extra ammo to the player when picked up by the player.

        • cantDie

          PowerUp cantDie
          The PowerUp cantDie is an invincibility object. I called it cantDie because it was easier to write out than Invincibility, When the player is invincible , then the player can't die.'

        • radarPosition

          int[] radarPosition
          The array radarPosition holds the location of the radar when it initially spawns

        • bulletPosition

          int[] bulletPosition
          The array bulletPosition holds the location of the extraBullet object when it initially spawns

        • inviPosition

          int[] inviPosition
          The array inviPosition holds the location of the cantDie object when it initially spawns

        • win

          boolean win
          The boolean win is initially set to false until the player finds the room with the briefcase.

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject.Invincibility extends PowerUp implements Serializable

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject.NinjaOctopi extends Entity implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • direction

          int direction
          This integer value is used to identify the direction the ninja should move on the Grid.

        • playerInSight

          boolean playerInSight
          This is a boolean value that is used in the NinjaOctopi.setDirection(int, int) method to flag whether or not a Taha object is in 'sight' of the Ninja.

        • isShot

          boolean isShot
          Boolean value that keeps track of whether or not the NinjaOctopi is 'shot' by the Taha object.

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject.PowerUp extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • seen

          boolean seen
          This boolean determines if the powerup is seen by the player or not.

        • isUsed

          boolean isUsed
          This boolean determines if the powerup is picked by the player or not.

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject.Radar extends PowerUp implements Serializable

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject.Room extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • briefcase

          boolean briefcase
          The boolean briefcase is an attribute that all rooms possess. A room will either have a briefcase or not, only one room may have a briefcase at any given instance of the game.

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject.Taha extends Entity implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • lives

          int lives
          The integer lives represents how many times the Taha object can die until it is game over.

        • ammo

          int ammo
          The integer field ammo keeps track of the player's ammo. Without ammo, the player will be unable to fire their swag blaster.

        • cantDieDuration

          int cantDieDuration
          The integer field cantDieDuration is a counter that counts down after every turn that the player uses up. This countdown will start when the player grabs the invincibility power up.

        • playerDirection

          int playerDirection
          The integer field playerDirection keeps track where the player is facing. This is so the player can't attempt to enter a room unless they are facing the 6 o'clock position.

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject.TrueRoom extends Room implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • briefcase

          boolean briefcase
          The boolean briefcase dictates whether or not a room is in the possession of the briefcase.
